intro: Renealmia stenostachys, commonly known as the narrow-stalked renealmia, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its small, spike-like inflorescence contains numerous tiny, white to pale green flowers. Renealmia stenostachys is often found in wetland or swampy habitats, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
